parallel

Class ComplexBarrier

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.ComplexBarrier

  • public class ComplexBarrier
extends java.lang.Object
    A class implementing the Barrier concept in parallel/distributed computing. Before thread groups wishing to coordinate on barrier points can use this class, a "setup" must occur either via a call to ComplexBarrier.addThread(t) or (recommended) ComplexBarrier.addThread(groupname, t). Each of the added threads to "synchronize" on the barrier point then calls ComplexBarrier.getInstance([groupname]).barrier(); The threads wait at this point until all threads added actually reach this point, at which time, they resume execution. Once threads start calling the barrier() method it is forbidden for other threads to call the addThread([name,]t) method (behavior becomes undefined). If a thread wishes to leave a barrier it may do so by calling Barrier.removeCurrentThread([groupname]) If a thread other than the ones originally entering the barrier (via setup) calls the barrier() methods then a ParallelException will be thrown.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void addThread(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Thread t)
      method has the same purpose as the addThread(t) call, except that it creates a separate Barrier instance that can be referenced by the getInstance(name) call, so that several Barrier objects can co-exist in the same program.
      static void addThread(java.lang.Thread t)
      method must be called before barrier() can be used.
      void barrier()
      main method of the class: it waits until _origNumThreads threads enter this method, and it guarantees that if a thread enters this method again before all threads have exited the previous barrier() call it will wait first for all the other threads to exit and then will proceed.
      static ComplexBarrier getInstance()
      returns the instance that was created by a prior call to addThread(t)

    • Method Detail

      • addThread

        public static void addThread(java.lang.Thread t)
        method must be called before barrier() can be used. It should be invoked only once for each group of threads which to coordinate with the barrier() call.
        Parameters:
        t - Thread

      • addThread

        public static void addThread(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Thread t)
        method has the same purpose as the addThread(t) call, except that it creates a separate Barrier instance that can be referenced by the getInstance(name) call, so that several Barrier objects can co-exist in the same program.
        Parameters:
        name - String the name with which the Barrier object can be later got
        t - Thread a thread that will be coordinated on this Barrier

      • removeCurrentThread

        public static void removeCurrentThread()
                                throws ParallelException
        removes the current thread from having to synchronize on the default barrier.
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • removeCurrentThread

        public static void removeCurrentThread(java.lang.String name)
                                throws ParallelException
        removes the current thread from having to synchronize on the barrier with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if the barrier name does not exist or if the thread was not a participant in this barrier.

      • getInstance

        public static ComplexBarrier getInstance()
        returns the instance that was created by a prior call to addThread(t)
        Returns:
        ComplexBarrier

      • getInstance

        public static ComplexBarrier getInstance(java.lang.String name)
        returns the instance that was created by a prior call to ComplexBarrier.addThread(name,t)
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        ComplexBarrier

      • removeInstance

        public static void removeInstance(java.lang.String name)
                           throws ParallelException
        remove the instance named after the argument passed in from the known data-base of Barrier instances (maintained by this class). The caller must ensure that no threads will call the barrier() method for the instance to be deleted again, otherwise deadlocks may arise (some threads waiting on the barrier, and the remaining threads will never be able to call the barrier() method again).
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if there was no such Barrier instance in the data-base of Barrier instances.

      • barrier

        public void barrier()
             throws ParallelException
        main method of the class: it waits until _origNumThreads threads enter this method, and it guarantees that if a thread enters this method again before all threads have exited the previous barrier() call it will wait first for all the other threads to exit and then will proceed.
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if current thread is not registered via addThread

      • placeThread

        private void placeThread(java.lang.Thread t)

      • removeThread

        private void removeThread(java.lang.Thread t)

        private boolean passBarrier()
